page.title: 13CRIEFF DANCING SCHOOL
page.content: In a church hall in Crieff, on several afternoons every week, scores of young ladies attend Mrs. Shuttleworth's Dance School. Not only do they learn ballet, but Polish,tap, disco and scottish. Part of the time is spent working towards exams such as primary grade 1, grade 2, grade 3, grade 4 and senior grade. The highlight of the year however is the display, which is given in the High School Hall on two evenings in June. Some of the routines this year were; SHOW BUSINESS, HAPPY FEET, GHOSTBUSTERS, YELLOW BIRD, ALL I WANT FOR CHRISTMAS, BIG BALLET, CAROUSEL, FLY A KITE and GITTERBUG. Many of the girls think as I do when I say "Ithink ballet is the best thing in the world."
